title: If someone entrusts me (Amanah) with his money, can I use it knowing I can pay back? assim al hakeem
transcript: if someone gives me his money as Amana is it permissible for me to use it if I know that inshallah when he asked me to return it I will be able to return He return him from my own money all Scholars say that when a person is entrusted with a deposit within a manner it is not permissible for him to utilize it or to use it because this is not a debt this isn't a manner so someone gives me a thousand dollars and he said this is an Amana keep it with you I keep it with me and few weeks later I need to use these thousand dollars to buy groceries or to fix my car or to pay the rent I have the resources to compensate it from I have people I can borrow from I have my paycheck is coming so I say to myself it's lying there it's a thousand dollars let me talk take it and use it and when the person who gave it to me comes I will find means to pay it off the answer is totally prohibited this is something you were entrusted with you cannot use it unless you ask for permission this is not alone when I borrow a thousand dollars from people I can do with it whatever I want whenever they come back I have to give it to them whenever they ask for it and a man is a different thing it's something that you were interested with and you can't utilize it without their permission
